summary: The Bureau of Prisons provides a portfolio of drug education and treatment programs to help federal inmates with substance use disorders. In fiscal year 2019, the Bureau began treating inmates with opioid use disorder via a new medication-assisted treatment program. The Bureau is expanding this program, but hasn’t documented how it will gauge the additional agency personnel needed, how it plans to recruit and onboard...
title: Bureau of Prisons: Improved Planning Would Help BOP Evaluate and Manage Its Portfolio of Drug Education and Treatment Programs
